formattedAddress: 619 W 54th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 619 W 54th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text:
I had surgery performed on oct 10th at Manhattan  surgery center.  From the moment, I arrived I was treated in a very professional and caring way.  I could not have been more pleased with the attention and treatment I received.
Nicolette and Shelby were my nurses,  they were wonderful , skilled and performed their duties in a cheerful and kind way.  They are a credit to Manhattan surgical center.
Dr Hoffman performed the surgery.  He is truly a combination of everything
Wonderful in a surgeon.  He is  very skilled, kind,  and a pleasure to interact with.   I am so happy to have him as my doctor..
Dr Gissle  was my anesthesiologist. ( I can’t remember her last name, ) but she was proficient, caring and reassuring .  Could not ask for more . I would like to also mention Joann Rivers, who greeted as I arrived. A big smile and extremely helpful.  bless them all!

originalText.text: Everything was done very precisely. Everybody was very friendly and they made sure I was comfortable. Dr. A Schwartz was excellent. Didn’t waste my time; efficient. Highly recommended

text.text: Everything was done very precisely. Everybody was very friendly and they made sure I was comfortable. Dr. A Schwartz was excellent. Didn’t waste my time; efficient. Highly recommended

originalText.text: I’ve been to Dr. Pakeman twice in the past few years for different procedures and love his work.

text.text: I’ve been to Dr. Pakeman twice in the past few years for different procedures and love his work.

originalText.text: Please avoid this place at all costs. I was scheduled for surgery and they canceled the day before, without even notifying me, because 'I'm obese'. How unqualified does an anesthesiologist need to be not to be able to calculate medication for an 'obese' person??

text.text: Please avoid this place at all costs. I was scheduled for surgery and they canceled the day before, without even notifying me, because 'I'm obese'. How unqualified does an anesthesiologist need to be not to be able to calculate medication for an 'obese' person??

originalText.text: Getting my first surgery in my early 30s was nerve racking but all the nurses and the staff were extremely accommodating and took the edge off from my anxiety. They were attentive, courteous and  answered all my questions timely. In a time of high-stress their demeanor made me feel relaxed. Facilities were pristine.
